attributes.action: Ban garden bonfires during Coronavirus lockdown.
attributes.additional_details: During lockdown people have limited access to outside some are lucky enough to have gardens to enjoy others not. So having windows and doors open is the only way to enjoy fresh air. If people are self isolating with coronavirus, they have been told to do so in a well ventilated room eg windows open should there be a bonfire in the area, a person with respiratory problems will struggle to breathe. People in their homes should not be subjected to breathing in bonfire fumes during enforced lockdown
attributes.background: Ban all garden waste bonfires during enforced lockdown and self isolation
